characters: A KNOCK AT THE FRONT DOOR.
...AND INTO THE CANNERY WHERE JOHN LIES ON THE FLOOR WITH
...AND WE FOLLOW THE BULLET BACK UP TOWARDS THE SNIPER'S
...AND PUNCHES THROUGH THE BACK OF HIS HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A verdant landscape of rolling hills, lush countryside, a ambient peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, quaint, two-bedroom farmhouse: a classic. Nearby small barn -its paint chipped, wood worn- sits nestled wi the setting. The homestead feels slightly abandoned, the facade -especially the roof- in dire need of an overhaul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hour hand of an old, electric clock shifts slightly, marking six a.m. A soft alarm sounds. Beneath the blanket a body shifts, a weathered hand reaching out to silence t antique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... a sigh... a groan... and JOHN WICK -early sixti salt-and-pepper hair, three-day beard, former boxer, form military, tired, beaten down, and at wit's end- sits up, staring unblinkingly out at the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and he stands, donning a weathered robe and a p of slippers. John stuffs his hands into his pockets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and shuffles down the corridor, the walls overflowing family pictures, each badly in need of dusting. They catalogue a long and healthy life with his wife, Norma; t pictures presenting a time line of sorts. No children, ye sheer, unadulterated happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John makes his way through his home, we can see that i cluttered and unorganized. Dirty, in fact, as if it hasn' been cleaned in months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John opens the door, retrieves the newspaper, closes, and locks the door behind him, without giving the outside so as a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John unceremoniously tosses the newspaper onto the table, opens a cupboard, and measures out a couple of tablespoon Folgers Coffee into an old percolator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it begins to bubble, John open the fridge, studies its contents for a moment or two, and then closes it, abandon the thought of breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours himself a cup of coffee and sits at the table. T newspaper is ignored. He drinks in silence for a long, da brooding moment, the loneliness almost unsettling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the phone on the wall RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John lowers his cup, staring at the device, his eyes tire A beat... and he stands, walking slowly to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he listens to the voice on the other end, John remains still... stoic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hangs up the phone and returns to the table, sinking slowly down into his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and John begins to weep, his hands trembling as he low his face in excruciating, utter, and complete sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having shaved and showered, wearing an old -but well-fitt gray suit, John pushes open the garage door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to reveal a legend in dire need of a total overhaul: a black, 1969 FORD MUSTANG `BOSS 429'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile plays at his lips as John walks into the garage, running a hand along the chassis, desperately in need of wash and wax. Behind him, the wall is lined with tools: a mechanic's dream enclave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and closes the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes a moment to breath it in: he loves this car... although he hasn't taken very good care of it as of late. beat... and he slips the key into the ignition, twisting the motor coughing to life, the exhaust pipe belching bla smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicle pulls out of the garage, stalls briefly, come back to life, puttering on down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soft rain begins to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a humble bouquet of yellow daisies, John slowly makes his way down the eerily empty corridor. He pauses before a picture on the wall, glancing at his reflection the glass. He takes a deep breath, exhales, and enters a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John slowly approaches the figure lying in bed: surrounde machinery, accompanied by the soft sounds of technology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He removes the wilted daisies from the vase, tosses them the trash, and replaces them with fresh ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls over a chair, reaches out, and takes Norma's han she is comatose, her breathing synthetic... so many machines... so many wires, tubes, and monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never see her face:   just her silhouette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds her hand for a long moment in heavy silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, the DOCTOR -of a similar age to John- enters, placing a hand on John's shoulder. John lowers his head, nods. With a bit of effort, he stands, staring down at he for a long moment, never once releasing his grip, and lea over to kiss her on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it had to be you... (a long beat, then) ...be seein' ya'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and John nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor turns off the machine; lights dim, the room settles into silence, and Norma's body grows still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor leaves John to be alone with his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be seein' you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls into the building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and sits behind the wheel for a long moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...his eyes unblinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so very alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands before the wall of pictures, statuesque as he studies them... unmoving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, he snaps; his hands gnarled into first, roaring with rage as he punches the pictures, ripping them from t wall, tossing them aside, eventually collapsing into a he out of breath, his knuckles bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat... and he chuckles softly, pulling himself to feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlike the rest of the house, this space is pristine and organized: one half designated as an impressive wood shop the other an office space with a lazy boy recliner and tu television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits at his desk with a pencil in hand, a pad of pap before him, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat... and he sighs with a smile, placing the pen upon the pad before sliding them both aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John unscrews the cap off the bottle of scotch and pours himself a healthy dose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens his desk drawer, reaches into the back, and find old pack of cigarettes, half-empty. He taps one from, pla it between his lips, and lights it, taking a deep pull. H holds it, and exhales, his body relaxing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes his drink along with the cigarette, pours him another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then opens a BOTTLE OF PILLS (The label reading NO WICK and OXYCONTIN), pouring them into a small mound upon desk. He stares at them for a long moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...before selecting one, studying it, sighing and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John freezes, not sure as to how best to proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and someone KNOCKS a second time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sighs, drops the pill back onto the mound, and walks upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DELIVERY WOMAN waits for him on the doorstep.   John op the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Wick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a clipboard and a pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign here, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a daze, John signs the clipboard and hands it back to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the pen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hands her the pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Delivery Woman hands him a card and a PLASTIC CASE by handle which he takes without looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John nods, and -as she takes off- heads back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John closing the door behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and is startled by a small BARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and he looks down to find that he is actually holding a small PET CARRIER. He lifts it to look inside: the face of a young, tri-colored (black, white, and brown CHORGI (half-Corgi, half-Chihuahua) looks out at him, her tail wagging fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She barks again, and John lowers it, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding the envelope in his hands, John sits across from carrier which he has set upon the table. Inside, the Chor lies with paws crossed, studying him, tilting her head fr side to side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and John opens the letter. The card inside is simple; white with a single DAISY drawn upon it. John smi instantly knowing who it is from, running a thumb along t face of the flower. He hesitates, but opens the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear, John. If you have received this, then I have not survived the surgery. (a beat, then) I am so, so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears begin to well in John's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you've still got a life ahead of you, and I intend for you to live it. You may think you've hidden things from me, but you haven't. I know you. And should this reach you in time -which I pray it has- I beg you, I implore you, to stop. To think. To live. (a beat, then) I love you, John. With all my heart. Our years were good. The best, in fact. But I'd rather see you later... than sooner... your best friend... Norma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John lowers the letter, wipes the tears from his cheeks, stares at the puppy... chuckling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well played, Norma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John reaches across, and flicks open the pet carrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well played.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chorgi scrambles out of the cage and studies him; sniffing, licking, and barking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... you gotta' name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John checks the collar to find a DAISY-SHAPED medallion w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moose. (a beat, then) Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if in reply, Moose barks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Moose, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The homestead has been completely overhauled with a new r on the house, the barn having been painted, the yard atte to... a picturesque scene worthy of a postcard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alarm sounds, followed by silence when a heavy hand d down upon the snooze button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and John sighs, pulls back the covers, and kick out his legs, sitting on the edge of the bed, rubbing his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John glances over at MOOSE who lies on the bed, her paws crossed, held tilted, and tail excitedly wagging in notes three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm up, I'm up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - John fries up a couple of pieces of bacon and adds them his plate of scrambled eggs and toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kneels down next to Moose's bowl and pours some of the bacon grease over the kibble. As John takes his seat at t table to enjoy his coffee, breakfast, and newspaper, Moos devours her meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - With his car tilted up by jack stands, John lays upon a creeper cart beneath it, changing the oil as -nearby- Moo lies in the sun, fast asleep. The vehicle is pristine: fu restored and lovingly detailed. Finishing up, John slides out from beneath the vehicle, and wipes the grease from h hands with a shop towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That oughta' do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna' try it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - At an abandoned airfield, the Mustang roars down the op stretch of landing strip as Moose stands at the open wind tongue wagging in the air. John is in his element: calm, cool, and collected behind the wheel of his car... almost if it is a natural extension of himself. He deftly shifts gears, reaching speeds in excess of 120 miles per hour be hitting a long patch of gravel, shifting, spinning the wh and skidding -while remaining in full control- as the whe skim over the earth. Moose barks. John smiles, reaching over to scratch her on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good girl, Moose. Good girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - At a small park, John sits at a picnic table, eating a sandwich as he works his way through a small book of crossword puzzles. A cup of hot coffee rests nearby as beneath the table, Moose gnaws on a tough piece of rawhid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -At a gas station, Moose barks at passing bikers as John fills the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IOSEF TARASOV -mid-twenties, thin, oiled hair, sunglasses hipster, douche-bag- parks his vintage BMW next to the Fo and as he gasses up, motions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't for sale, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef smirks with a shake of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Everything's got a fucking price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Maybe so... but I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taken aback by John's fluency, he watches as John enters vehicle, guns the engine, and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - John dozes on the couch as -between his legs- Moose sno softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - As John washes his car, Moose chases after birds before exhausted- laying upon her back in the sun, stretching as gnaws upon her favorite stuffed animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - With a glass of scotch resting on the end table beside John sits in his weathered La-z-boy recliner with his rea glasses on, a book before him, and Moose curled up, aslee his lap. A beat... and John closes his book, finishes his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and stands, with Moose leaping to the floor, leading the back upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Moose lays on the foot of the bed, tail wagging.      J smiles, scratching her belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Moose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John climbs beneath the covers, sighs, and slips off to s as does Moose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John awakes to hear Moose growling with tail thumping, sitting before the closed door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need to go out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John groans as he rolls out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So could I, it would seem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John opens the door.    Moose barks, and sprints off into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's gotten into y-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a THUMP and a YELP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John runs into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and freezes at the sight of two MASKED MEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a half-second before a THIRD MAN steps into frame and drives the butt of his shotgun against the side of John's head. He drops to the floor, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the room, the silhouette of Moose's body faces him her breathing labored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) You find the keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the masked men, LIMPS by, dragging his foot slight an old injury or birth defect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Yeah. He kept `em in a bowl like my old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voice #1 chuckles enjoying this as he sucks on a fresh mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Then shit... let the fuckin' babushka fade away and let's get the fuck outta' here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the men kneels down next to John, pulling back his mask to reveal his mouth which grins upon him with white lacquered teeth: it is IOSEF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you didn't wanna' sell, old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I enjoyed this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef cold cocks John as we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...thump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...thump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small tail rises slowly, and lands with a soft "thump".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stirs with a groan, and opens his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to find Moose's nose touching his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly sits up, remembering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Moose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moose takes a shallow breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...thump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John begins to unravel, hands trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches Moose's side, and she whimpers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John recoils...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and sees the trail of blood from where she was first injured...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...having pulled her broken body over to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John lies down beside Moose, and softly... tenderly... cradles her head in his hand, rubbing her cheek with his thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moose relaxes, licks his thumb, sighs one last time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and grows still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls himself up into a sitting position, cradles Moose's still body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and begins to cry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...rocking back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John remains sitting on the floor with Moose in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat... and he stands; an old, weary, and defeated soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John flicks on the light and walks down the stairs, gentl placing Moose's body upon his work bench. He searches a shelf and finds a large box which he unfolds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...placing Moose's body within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and John reaches down to retrieve Moose's stuffed anim from the floor, placing it down beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a tender -careful- touch, John removes Moose's colla placing it -almost with reverence- upon a nail in the wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stares down at his dog for a long moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...before closing the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John digs a small grave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...places the box, staring at it for a long moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then fills the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his hands and knees, John brushes the blood from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes a long, hot shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sprays a bit of shaving foam into his hand, unfolds hi ceramic razor, stares at it for a long moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and begins to shave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he does so, the stress leaves his shoulders, his eyes unblinking, his movements precise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With every flick of his wrist, John seems to change sligh his features hardening, relaxed, and yet wound tight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gets dressed, but the outfit is slightly different t we are used to seeing: dark, tailored pants, crisp white shirt, Italian shoes, and a black, leather jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look suits him although it is a tad bit unsettling, making for an intimidating veneer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sips coffee -no breakfast- alone at the table, stari at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like clockwork, he lifts his mug, sips, lowers it, waits patiently, lifts, sips, lowers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there are no micro-emotions, but it is anyone's guess is taking place in his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John leans heavy against the wall, staring at the picture We now notice that among the images of John and Norma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...are also pictures of John and Moose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John lowers his head with a sigh, massaging his brow, los thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he raises his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the change which has washed over him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus roars on by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits alone in the middle of the bus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...staring straight ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 24/7 chop shop, this facility is populated by dozens of hardened criminals, but has become the only family anyone knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a tight knit, loyal, and talented crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of vehicles are being repaired, dismantled, pain and the like: a non-stop flurry of activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking the floor, AURELIO -late sixties, hard eyes, soft smile, the father figure of this little family- banters w his crew before pausing to help lower a new engine into a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's Mustang roars down the street, tires clawing at th earth as it rounds a tight corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perched behind the wheel, IOSEF smiles as, in the passeng seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...VIKTOR -mid-twenties, short, stout, a pronounced LIMP, well-dressed, gawdy jewelry, terrible glasses- and, in th back seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...KIRILL -early thirties, enormous, muscular, meathead- cheers him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang pulls into the lot, and enters-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -pulling into an empty space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of OLDER MECHANICS notice the car, share an emotionless -yet knowing- look, set down their tools, and calmly leave the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef, Viktor, and Kirill pour out of the vehicle, laughi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Shit, dude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'ma gonna' keep this muthafucker! (to a mechanic) Hey, where's Aurelio at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef sees Aurelio walking towards him, his gaze locked o the Mustang, recognizing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gots my ways, yo! Now, it's hot as shit, so I wanna paint job, papers, fuckin-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, where... did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some old fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) I know this car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you sayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurelio opens the driver's side door, reaches up behind t visor, and pulls out the registration card which reads JO WICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Italian, subtitled) Fuck... me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurelio quickly replaces the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out.    Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now, everyone in the facility has stopped working, watching the drama unfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talkin' about you takin' this fuckin' car and gettin' the fuck outta' my shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you lose your shit, Aurelio? We own you. You do what we say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck you do. Tell me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurelio motions towards the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...did you kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I sure as hell fucked up his dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurelio's eyes grow wide... knowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprising even himself, Aurelio rears back and delivers powerful blow to the center of Iosef's face, shattering h nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, Iosef reels and drops to a knee, cradling his fa blood seeping between his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a knee jerk reaction, Kirill pulls his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The atmosphere immediately grows tense, the air still, as throughout the building- Aurelio's mechanics each reach f hidden weapon: knives, machetes, guns, and the like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurelio glares -unblinking- at Kirill as he walks towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pull a gun? On me?   In my house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurelio presses his forehead against Kirill's outstretche gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flick off the safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill smirks, and flicks off the safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill blinks, faltering in this game of brinkmanship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, either shoot me... (shouts, angry) ...OR FUCK OFF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Viktor lowers Kirill's arm and we can see he is relieved that Viktor intervened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man ain't gonna' like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not.     But he'll understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor and Kirill help a still dazed Iosef to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the fuck jus' happened...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus pulls away from the curb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and John crosses the street, making a b-line for Aurel automotive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters the building which is silent:       everyone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John carefully makes his way through the floor, rounding shelving array to find Aurelio -a cigarette dangling from between his lips- sitting at a folding card table, his ha folded in front of him, a bottle of Campari and two glass resting nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Aurelio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurelio flips over the glasses and pours two drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes a glass and slams back the drink, swallowed in single gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have, but it's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I turn down the work, the Russians turn to Takeshi and his crew. You'll find them down on Third and Main.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns to leave, but hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat, then) Aurelio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they killed my dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, John. I know... but "they"... (hesitating, then) ..."they" are extremely dangerous people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John nods and walks from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't "they" always...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, and Aurelio sighs, relaxing as he pours hims another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old, quiet, and clean building lost amongst dozens of others in a dying industrial park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus pulls up the curb, pauses for a beat, and then roll off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...leaving behind John who walks across the street, his expression blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His gait is steady, his shoulders relaxed, hands limp at sides, breath steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two GUARDS at the door glance up as he approaches, standing as they shift into character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without slowing, John reaches into the man's jacket, slip free the pistol from the shoulder holster therein and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -fires -twice- into the man's heart, before turning-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - to fire once into the other guard's face, never slowing kicking open the door-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -to enter the facility, shooting anything that moves. He the angel of death: each target receives two well-placed bullets to ensure incapacitation. He never slows, never misses, and will not stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The primarily Japanese crew is in a panic with most fleei a number of whom are shot in the back- while those choosi to shoot back are cut down in a blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once emptied, John drops his pistol, kneels, sweeps up a fallen gun up, levels, fires, always moving, and -as he passes by a lift- slaps a button, slowly lowering his Mus down to the floor behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is a force of nature as he clears out the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unstoppable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of mechanics escape the building, the last of wh is shot in the back; dropping to his knees as a bullet sl into the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running with all of his might, MECHANIC #1 screams into h phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese, subtitled) I DON'T KNOW WHO THE FUCK HE IS! HE JUST SHOWED UP AND STARTED SHOOTING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, John appears in the doorway, aims...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and decides otherwise, lowering the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John opens the door to the Mustang, tosses the pistol ont the passenger's seat-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and slips behind the wheel. A slight smile plays upon hi lips as he sighs; a part of him having been returned. He turns the key, revs the engine, slams his foot down on th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and crashes through the garage door of the building, tir squealing as the Mustang pulls a one-eighty, righting its

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -leaping out onto the street, furiously gaining momentum, a trio of heavily-modified NISSAN SKYLINES appear and tak chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John glances into the rearview mirror, takes the pistol i his left hand, shifts, and spins the wheel-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -turning to face the oncoming vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John shifts again, and crushes the gas pedal underfoot-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -rear wheels smoking as they struggle to grip the road. O they do, however, the Mustang leaps forward, bearing down the Skylines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the distance between them grows smaller, the passenger two of the skylines emerge with semi-automatic weapons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but before either of them can fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...John fires off four shots, killing them each with a pa of bullets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...before firing until empty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...killing two drivers, and one passenger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...leaving one driver barrelling towards him, covered in passenger's blood, eyes wide with horror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as the two other cars crash behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the two vehicles barrel towards one another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...John is stoic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...while the remaining driver is screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the last moment, the driver violently twists the steer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -barely avoiding the Mustang-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -but loses control of the vehicle, sending it toppling en over end, cart-wheeling amidst a cloud of debris, before landing upside down-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -the gas tank having ruptured, fuel gurgling out of the t to pool around the crushed rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver hangs from his seat, his belt keeping him in place, stunned and bleeding from the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...followed by the sound of footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the driver shifts in his seat, a ZIPPO LIGHTER falls o of his pocket, landing on the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John kneels down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese, subtitled) Where can I find Iosef Tarasov?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese, subtitled) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and John reaches inside to retrieve the lighter He flips it open, and ignites a flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese, subtitled) Don't! Please! Iosef! His father! He owns a club in Manhattan! The Red Circle! The Red Circle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and John closes the lighter and tosses it back the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese, subtitled) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat... and the driver sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese, subtitled) Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John walks back towards his vehicle, we can hear the s of cop cars approaching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as a police chopper soars past overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John doesn't look up as he quickly removes the front and license plates -both affixed with quick release clasps- tosses them into the back seat, and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -slips behind the wheel. He twists, the key, revs the engine, and bolts forward as behind him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -a pair of police cars round the corner-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and overhead, the helicopter banks, its sights set on th Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John leads the cops further and further into the city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with traffic growing heavier with every block...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and yet John maintains his speed-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -driving down narrow service alleys with reckless abandon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and going against traffic, steering with an apt hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually, John creates enough mayhem to tie up the poli on the ground-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -leaving the helicopter overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a long stretch of road, John reaches the vehicle's top speed, reaches down, flips open a hidden compartment, and presses a button for-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -his NITROUS OXIDE SYSTEM-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -which causes the engine to SCREAM, roaring down the road an incredible speed-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -distancing himself from the helicopter to eventually hid an abandoned warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He parks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and walks across the street to the local diner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as overhead, the police chopper searches in vain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor is empty, the building quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting at his desk, Aurelio -a cigarette dangling from between his lips- works on a model car, carefully gluing pieces together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottle of Campari rests nearby.     Music plays softl a radio nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings.     Aurelio takes a deep breath, exhales answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Aurelio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you've struck my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deep breath, sighs) Yes, sir. I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might I ask why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he stole John Wick's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat, then) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Viggo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son killed his dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat, then) Good evening, Aurelio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click - the line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurelio refills his drink... and chuckles with a shake of head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A resplendent home in one of the city's wealthiest neighborhoods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trio of military-grade SEDANS -heavily armored, tinted/bulletproof glass, intimidating- pull up to the cu The first and third empty as the keen eyes of ten gunmen scour the street, buildings, and rooftops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and one of them slaps a hand on the middle Seda roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preceded -and proceeded- by a gunman, IOSEF emerges; belligerently naive and yet... scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighting himself a cigarette, VIGGO TARASOV -60s, face scarred by a hard life, one eye dead, hair perfectly coif expensive suit, a slight limp, relying on a cane- fills a tumbler with ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He selects a fresh bottle of JEWEL OF RUSSIAN CLASSIC VOD and twisting off the cap, hesitating. Deciding otherwise, Viggo dumps out the ice, pours himself a double shot, and slams it back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...before refilling the glass with ice and pouring himsel healthy dose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and closes the door behind him, tilting his chin towards father with a smirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor me a double, aye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a surprising blur of motion, Viggo spins-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and drives a fist into Iosef's stomach with enough force lift him -momentarily- from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the wind knocked out of him, Iosef drops to his knee opens his mouth to say something, but instead vomits, gag as he gasps for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo casually returns to the bar, grabs a towel, and tos it down onto his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Clean that up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Iosef opens his mouth to say something, but decide otherwise. He grabs the towel and cleans up his mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo takes his drink and walks to the window, his cigare smoldering from the corner of his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should know by now that I live by one simple rule... (in Russian, subtitled) Should a whelp snap at your fingers, you crush it's fucking skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef pulls himself to his feet, and stumbles to the bar, pouring himself a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed, pained) What'd I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) You fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what y-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo backhands him, the sound more painful than the stri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   You do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitating, then) So I stole a fucking car!   So fucking what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo smiles -amused- finishes his drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and drives a fist into Iosef's stomach again, dropping once more to his knees, tears rolling down his cheeks as vomits up his own drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use that tone with me again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo kneels down next to Iosef, grabs his hair, pulls ba his head, produces a switchblade, flicking open the blade placing it to the flesh directly beneath his son's right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) ...and I'll serve your eye to you in your martini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trembling, Iosef chokes back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Am I understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gulps, then) Yes... father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and Viggo removes the blade from Iosef's cheek stands, folding the switchblade closed as he stands to po himself another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't the "what you did", Iosef, which draws my ire, but "who you did it to".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (a beat, then) The old man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, son... that old man happens to be three years younger than I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef lowers his eyes, his breath catching in the back of throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is John Wick... (smirks at the memory) ...and when he was fifteen, he lied his way into the marines and headed off to Vietnam. He specialized in force-oriented reconnaissance, meaning he often crossed over into enemy territory to both collect information and -should the opportunity present itself- fuck with the enemy in whatever way that he saw fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing an undershirt and pants, sweating profusely, John wields a SLEDGEHAMMER which he swings down onto the floor time and time again, cracking the concrete foundation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John earned four hundred and seventeen confirmed kills over the course of his five tours. The majority of those were done by hand, by blade, and by small caliber... which is unheard of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo takes a long pull off of his drink as the informati sinks into Iosef, the blood draining from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It got to him, though. Hell... How could it not? Even though he won every military distinction on record, including the Medal of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John has revealed an OLD TRAP DOOR IN THE FLOOR-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -John was eventually discharged - with high honors, of course- and found himself in the city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -which he swings open, revealing a ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...lookin' for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John grabs a flashlight and heads down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo lowers his empty glass as Iosef refills his glass w a trembling hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitating, then) What kind of work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John shines the light down a thin corridor stacked high w a variety of boxes, military containers, and briefcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John was the goddamned boogeyman; give him a name, request a method, and he'd get it done. Come hell or high water, by God... he'd get it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo leans against the fireplace, suddenly tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then one day, he fell in love and left the game. The years scrolled past, age set in, and he -like myself- had to watch the love of his life die. Suddenly alone, with no family to speak of, John deserved to live -and die- in peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John selects a black case, unclasps it, and swings it ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went and killed his fucking dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -to reveal a number of PISTOLS, SILENCERS, and AMMUNITION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef drops down into a chair, the comprehension of his actions clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until I say otherwise, you are under house arrest. Am I understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo turns to leave, chuckling softly to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Wick.     Good God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses at the door, glancing back at his son with a crooked smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Sweet dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits at the kitchen table, having cleaned and assemb one pistol, now oiling a second. His hands are steady, hi skill impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly move past him, over the counter, to the door wh handle softly turns. We pull back as it opens-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -FOUR MEN in black masks, each armed with a silenced pist enter, fanning out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and yet John is nowhere to be seen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and two silenced pistols are missing from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COP CAR pulls up in front of the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the wheel, CARLO -late twenties, a bit dim, but ni enough- kills the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlo checks the dashboard computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a black, 1969 Ford Mustang registered to one John Wick. Age...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckling EDWARDO -58, nearing retirement, large, heavy, smarter than he looks- takes a sip of coffee from his pap cup before unbuckling his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm thinkin' he's the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we even bother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: edwardo opens his door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protocol's protocol. Stay put. I'll make this quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four masked men enter the living room, each wound tig their silenced weapons at the ready. The lead among them enters the hallway-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and is shot twice; once in the chest, and once in the he As he goes down, John moves past, killing two others, lea the remaining gunmen-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -cowering in the kitchen, leaning against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -the kitchen light casting the gunman's shadow-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and fires twice into the wall-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -hitting the gunman in the back and the head, dropping hi the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John lowers the pistol, walks to the door, and peers thro the keyhole to see Edwardo standing on his porch. A beat. and John slips the pistol in the back of his pants, unloc and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward pause, then-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evenin', John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evenin', Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You workin' again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John follows his gaze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to see that a dead gunman is in Edwardo's direct line sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...just sorting out a few things with the Russian mob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Well, then... sort that out however you see fit. I'll cover your ass on my side of the fence as best I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Ed... but you still owe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, I do. (a beat, then) Good night, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edwardo turns, takes a few steps, hesitates, and turns ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earlier today, there was an incident involving a `69 Mustang-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, then... I'd recommend you find yourself a new ride for the time being. The heat on that make ain't gonna' die down for quite some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edwardo leaves.   John closes and locks the door behind h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edwardo slips into his seat, closing the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't our fuckin' guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's next on the list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls a large roll of plastic sheeting down from the rafters, balancing it on his shoulder with a grunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a roll of duct tape as he exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John drops the plastic sheeting down upon the floor, and rolls it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing over one of the gunmen, he reaches down, retriev the man's pistol, and slips it into the holster at the ma side. John then kneels beside him and pushes the body ont the plastic, rolling him up tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using his ceramic straight razor, the plastic is cut off the roll. Wrapping the feet, arms, and head tight with du tape, John repeats this process with each body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until they are neatly lined up near the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes the phone off the wall, thinks for a long mome and dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Wick. John Wick, that's right. Yeah, it has been awhile. (a beat, then) I'd like to make a reservation for four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John glances at the bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten o'clock? Perfect. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John casually opens one of a half-dozen, identical, silve cases stacked among the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside are hundreds of AMERICAN LIBERTY GOLD BULLION COIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John counts out SIX of them, and closes the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John mops up the blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and spackles the bullet holes in his wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a KNOCK at the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John wipes his hands against his pants, and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Removing his hat, CHARLIE -70s, small, creepy, thin, frai eyes gentle, a tattooed smirk upon his lips- extends his with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie enters, followed by two GOONS -forties, tall, muscular, emotionless- who offer John little more than a before they begin carrying the bodies out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sorry to hear about Norma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was always kind to me. (a beat, then amused) So, what have you been doing to pass the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got me a hobby or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, John... are we back in the game, now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Charlie, but no.     I'm on my own nowadays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a pity. I find the new breed of your ilk unstable, ill- wrought, and tiresome. The overused adage holds true: they don't make `em like they used to, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a go, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hands Charlie the six gold coins which he graciously accepts with a slight tilt of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure, John... and might I be expecting more such visitations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I make no promises on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie extends his hand.     John shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be seein' you, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya', Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutting vegetables with a large knife, Viggo slides them the face of an open omelette simmering in the pan. As he folds the egg over onto itself, his phone rings. He answe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo rubs his brow with a frown, his head down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Of course he did. (a beat, then) Put the word out. Two million to the man who kills John Wick. Three million to the man who delivers him intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo hangs up, thinks for a moment, slips the omelette o a plate, hesitates, and then dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful, rustic, Mediterranean setting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Situated on a hundred acres populated by thousands of alm trees, the building -complimented by the grounds- is breathtaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accompanied by CESCA -a middle-aged, Majorcan Shepherd Do similar in look to a Black Labrador- as he walks -cane in hand- through his property, MARCUS -seventy, thin, baldin round spectacles, clean shaven, always well-dressed, expensive watch, and although he may look frail, he is anything but- whistles softly to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His cellphone vibrates.   He answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? (a beat, then) Why, hello, Viggo. What's it been? Seven years? Seven years... (a beat, then) Life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus looks around with a smile, reaching down to scratc Cesca behind the ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo nods, eating a mouthful of the omelette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, good. (hesitating, then) I've a favor to ask. One that pays quite well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus chuckles with a shake of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I keep telling those -like you- who keep calling, Viggo... I'm retired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus listens to Viggo talk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...pausing in mid-step...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...his brow furrowed, eyes still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come again? (a beat, then) John Wick? (a long beat, then) Consider it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus ends the call, slips the phone back into his pocke takes a deep breath, exhales, turns, and starts walking b to his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Catalan, subtitled) Sorry, Cesca... but I've an old friend to attend to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushing a cart of luggage before him, John enters, studyi the security checkpoint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spots EVAN -60s, African-American, weathered, large ma with a kind face- who works for the TSA, manning a securi checkpoint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John approaches the two share a knowing glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John places his keys, phone, wallet, and TWO GOLD COINS i the tray...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Evan casually flips off the x-ray machine, allowing both John and his luggage through without incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John retrieves his keys, phone, and wallet from the tray-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and walks on as Evan turns the x-ray machine back on, slipping the gold coins into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silver-nosed train roars past, its wheels melting snow the tracks beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits alone, the train half-empty, staring out at the countryside passing him by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city is a roiling mass of activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small, trendy, and posh:    an upscale, boutique hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a bulky briefcase in each hand -with the duffel slung across his shoulders- John approaches the front des where the MANAGER smiles up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, sir. How may I help you today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called ahead.     Reservation for John Wick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Manager checks his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes.   I have you for two nights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depending on business, it may be more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a problem, sir. We're only at sixty percent capacity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me know should you choose to extend your stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, I haven't been here in years. When did the old girl get a facelift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About twelve years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same owner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same owner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John slides across a GOLD COIN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she still singin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...which the Manager -without so much as a blink- slides his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is. Daily, in fact.   Round about midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Manager hands him a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floor seven, room nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like help with your bags?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will there be anything else then, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances at his watch) Can you send me up a hamburger - rare, mustard, onions, pickle- and fries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writing it down) Yes, sir. And to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nice Pinot. Mid-range. I'll leave that to your discretion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I have one in mind. It'll be up in a half-hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has begun to set;     the street lamps having beg ignite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half-eaten meal is scattered upon the table, the bottle wine half-empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resting upon the bed, the briefcases lie open, revealing veritable armory of dismantled weapons, numerous clips, a boxes of ammunition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting at the desk, John pauses from cleaning a pistol t empty the wine into his glass. Once done, he pulls back t slide, studies the pistol with a keen eye, releases it, carefully loads a clip with bullets, and slides it into t pistol: locked and loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a small wooden case, John selects a SILENCER which h screws onto the pistol. He sets it down next to a pump- action sawed-off SHOTGUN, a SNIPER RIFLE, an old school U SUBMACHINE GUN -silenced- with a polished mahogany stock, BAR DAGGER, and another pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and John stands, slips the silenced pistol into back of his pants, dons his jacket, turns off the light, leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An upscale night club, the line curled around the side of building, generously serviced by heat lamps to accommodat the almost non-existent dresses of the many young women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John approaches the BOUNCER -30s, Russian, massive, tatto neck, intimidating, his suit one size too small on purpos who controls entry, the guest list glowing upon his table computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hands him three, hundred dollar bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bouncer takes the bills, pockets them, and unclips th red velvet rope, allowing him entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John enters, those in the front of the line complain b are ignored as the rope is re-attached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strangely enough, the lobby is laid back and pleasant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single bar is available to the dozen or so patrons who lounge about smoking, laughing, and talking as servers wa the floor, offering a variety of appetizers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the lobby, however, is a security station -replete with a METAL DETECTOR- in front of the elevators: the "action" it would seem, is on the top floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John approaches the security station and pauses, dropping a knee to tie his shoe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and remove his silenced pistol, shoving it deep into t soil of a potted plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands, empties his pockets into a small plastic bin hands it to a guard, and walks through: he is clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes his things, enters the elevator, and presses t red "P" for penthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors to the elevator open, the music deafening.   Jo exits, turns left, and enters-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -a two-story structure with the VIPs assembled up top; ea having paid for their private tables. John enters, carefu studying the room. He approaches the bar and waves down a bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John motions upwards as he slides across five, hundred do bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bartender studies him... and then takes his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John follows the Bartender...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who slips a hundred dollar bill to each of the goons o either side of the staircase, heads upstairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and slips two bills to the Waitress-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -before returning to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John follows the Waitress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to a table with a perfect view of both levels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will this do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you like to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Single Malt. Irish, if you've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John slides her two more hundred dollar bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And start me up a tab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I've got a ten-year Michael Collins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. Do you have a meat and cheese plate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.   Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Waitress turns to fill his order, John studies the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the upper balcony... searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soft snow begins to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John nibbles on some cheese and bread as he pours himself generous helping of whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below, Viktor -finishing off his drink- LIMPS past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes his drink, stands, and follows after Viktor, almost breathing down his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book-ended by a pair of Estruscan bodyguards who follow e move he makes, Viktor slaps a waitress on the ass as he w past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Another bottle of the Goose, love!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John stares at Moose's silhouette...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...VIKTOR limps past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Yeah. He kept `em in a bowl like my old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drunk, Viktor and his bodyguards enter the bathroom, paus to light a cigarette, before limping into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -where he leans against the wall in front of the toilet, at half-mast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters as a patron leaves, the bathroom now empty sa himself, Viktor, and the bodyguards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door closes, John produces his CERAMIC STRAIGHT RA drives it between the door and the jamb, and snaps it in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A patron approaches the door and attempts to enter, but i won't budge. He shrugs and heads off in search of another bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the bodyguards turns as John approaches, his eyes instantly wide -uncomprehending- as the broken tip of the blade easily slices open his neck, splashing John with hi own hot blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor glances towards the closed door with a smirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the bodyguard drops to his knees -bleeding out- the se guard produces a pistol and -as John moves into him- mana to fire off a round which punches through John's shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viktor tenses -eyes wide- shakes off before zipping up hi pants, reaches into his jacket, and fumbles for his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a cry derived far more from anger than pain, John he butts the other bodyguard -shattering his nose, his face instantly crimson with blood- before slashing the remnant the blade wide, severing the bodyguard's artery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the bathroom stall opens and as Viktor emerge with pistol held out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -John slaps it aside, breaks his arm and kicks in his leg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -sending him to his knees, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John grabs the broken arm, twists it behind Viktor's back drags him towards the towel, grabs him by the hair, and shoves his face into the toilet. He holds him there for a good amount of time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...before ripping him back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gasping for breath, Viktor's eyes are wide, sobriety havi swiftly returned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck d-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John answers by slamming his head against the rim of the toilet -breaking Viktor's nose- before shoving his face b beneath the water. A long beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and John pulls Viktor back up for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) My name is John Wick. You took my car. You killed my dog. Where... is Iosef?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, old m-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind his back, John snaps Viktor's wrist, and -as he dr his face back beneath the water- John snaps one finger af the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underwater, Viktor screams, struggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls him free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIGGO! HIS FATHER! HE'S WITH VIGGO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where is Viggo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves about... from one place to the next... he's put Iosef under his thumb... wherever Viggo goes, so does Iosef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John twists Viktor's arm, breaking it with a dry SNAP. Viktor screams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but John keeps holding his arm painfully in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Where... is... Viggo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Please... I don't know... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and John drives Viktor's head down upon the toilet rim an odd angle, his neck snapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John removes Viktor's wallet and cellphone before exiting stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides Viktor's wallet into one pocket and his cell ph into another. At the sink, he turns on the cold water tap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...splashes it up into his face, turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and pauses, realizing that he is covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls off his shirt, wipes the blood from his face, tosses the shirt aside, reaches down, removes Viktor's sh and slips it on, carefully buttoning it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wets his hair, slicks it back, turns, removes the piec ceramic blade wedged in the door frame, tosses it into th trash, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John passes by the Waitress, pausing to hand her a couple hundred dollar bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please close out my tab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood from his shoulder wound begins to seep into the shirt, but only he notices it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John heads down the staircase-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and calmly makes his way through the sea of dancers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as up top, chaos erupts but is silenced by the deafeni music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using his one good shoulder, John opens the steel door, a his skin pale, cold sweat upon his brow- moves as fast as can downwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His shoulder hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood loss nears critical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John exits the building as he scrolls through Viktor's ph searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds Iosef's number, and as he calls it, studies the image of Iosef which appears on screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef lays on his bed with an arm behind his head, smokin he stares up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the vibration of his cell phone. He lifts the pho smiles at the sight of Viktor's caller I.D., and answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Hey, Vik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat, then) Viktor is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
