dialogues.text: Iosef bolts upright, his breath stuck in his throat, eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John trudges through the snow with Viktor's phone to his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As for the car, I got that back, but as for Moose, well... I'm takin' a page from Exodus on that one: an eye for an eye. (a beat, then) No... no, better yet, Genesis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adah and Zillah, hear my voice; Wives of Lamech, listen to my speech. For I have killed a man for wounding me, even a young man for hurting me. If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, then Lamech seventy-sevenfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John peers around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make your peace with God, Iosef... (in Russian, subtitled) ...for the Devil shall see you soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat... and Iosef hangs up his phone, staring at t wall... a solitary tear rolling down his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John tosses the phone down into the snow, and jogs across street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as MARCUS -a cigarette smoldering between his lips- watches him from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is empty -save the Manager- who glances up from computer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to find a wounded -and quite bloody- John walking towa him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evenin', sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evenin'.    Is the doctor in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.    Twenty-four/seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send him up, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.    Anything else, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends.    How good's your laundry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best, sir, however, I'm sorry to say that... (hesitating, then) ...no one's that good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John chuckles, sliding a gold coin across to the Manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I thought not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send me up a beer, too, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.    What do you favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in a chair with his shirt off and a beer in hand, John grits his teeth as the DOCTOR -80s, steady hands, glasses, thinning hair, frail, but strong- removes the bu from his shoulder, dropping it into a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she chip off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky for you, no.   It looks to be a sub-sonic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor cleans the wound, dries it off, and begins to shut the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor exits as John stands in the doorway, his shoul bound tight with gauze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sort of movement am I lookin' at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're lookin' to heal right quick, then keep it marginal. However, if you've still... (searching, then) ...got a bit a' business to attend to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor hands him a pill container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...take two of these beforehand. You will rip open, you will bleed, but you will have full function.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll hurt like hell, son... but come the long run, you'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hands the Doctor two gold coins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evenin', John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evenin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John closes the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow now falls harder, although the pace seems lazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in a fresh suit and tie, John strides through the kitchen, ignored by the bustling staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters the room, and makes his way to the back where small staircase leads downward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John walks down them and enters-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -walking down the long, brick-enclosed corridor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...stopping before a large, thick, imposing IRON DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John removes a gold coin from his pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and slips it into a slit -similar to that of a pay pho to the right of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and a section of the door slides open, revealing a pai judging eyes. This is EDDIE -30s, red beard, shaven head, pierced, tattooed, three piece suit- intimidating as hell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He studies John for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) I don't know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not... but I know this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and Eddie slides the view piece shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and the door is unlocked, swinging open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters, and the door is immediately swung shut behin sealed and locked tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is small, but comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the right are a number of coat/hat racks populated by dozen or so items.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the left is a bank of modified cigar locker; dozens of transparent, safety-deposit boxes framed in mahogany with plaque -etched with a name- upon each.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie hands the coin back to John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You carryin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John snaps back his wrist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and hands Eddie the ceramic straight blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta' name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Wick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie recognizes this name, his demeanor changing drastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie turns, finds a locker with the name JOHN WICK carve upon it, opens the small door, slides in the blade, and closes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta' name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and Eddie smiles, extending a hand, instantly w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They call me Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same goes for me, Mr. Wick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... call me, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters the room through a pair of velvet drapes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and pauses, taking it all in with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A luxurious tavern crafted from a long forgotten speak-ea the room isn't too big, and isn't too small, but... just right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booths line the outside walls while a number of tables ar scattered about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the stage, a small dance floor has been cleared, the wooden tiles worn, but lovingly cared for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stage, JENNY -80s, African-American, petite, a command presence- sways behind the microphone, singing an old standard, her voice similar to that of Billie Holiday; strong, tender, and sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes grow wide at the sight of John, but she never wa from her tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John makes his way through the room, everyone nodes, offers a handshake, or a simple greeting: this is an old family... of a sort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corner, WINSTON -70s, English, tall, lean, well- dressed, glasses, tailored, precise- sits with a worn, paperback copy of THE TELL-TALE SHREW in one hand and a d sherry in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Winston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston lowers the book, and glances across at John with blank -yet warm- look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jonathan. (a beat, then) It's been awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, it has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad to see the old place still up and runnin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could say the same for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John approaches the bar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where JIMMY -40s, African-American, three-piece suit, expensive watch, kind eyes, quick to smile- looks up with grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho... lee... shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two shake hands like old friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, my God, it's been... what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no good with time, but... it's been awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, it has. (a beat, then) We we're all broken up over Norma, y'know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got the card, the flowers... she knows you -all of you- loved her. (a beat, then) And thanks, Jimmy. It meant a lot to me as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shit, it's good to see you, John. What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love a martini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gin, dry, and onions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on and take a seat.    I'll be with you in a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All good, John... and seriously... it's good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John leaves Jimmy to make his martini, John strays tow the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny finishes her song, the audiences politely applauds, she steps down to give him a strong embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Wick in the flesh... my, oh, my... will wonders never cease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John smiles... almost sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where've you been keepin' yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not quite sure, but with that said... here I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you are, indeed.   My, oh, my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny hesitates, and then clasps a hand to his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss her, too, y'know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I haven't... I mean, not since the last time... (hesitating, then) Would you mind... if I sang it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can say, "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, Jenny... go right ahead. In fact... please do. I'd like to hear it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny hugs him again, kissing him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This visit of yours ain't no passin' fancy, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then... you be safe, you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, smiles) I hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny takes to the stage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as John sinks into his booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -as he slides a martini across to John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stage, Jenny whispers to the members of her small band before taking to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been awhile, but... here's to the past... may it influence our future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music begins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Jenny sings IT HAD TO BE YOU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her rendition is powerful, sweet, endearing, passionate, sincere. As John watches her sing, a smile tugs at the co of his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the empty dance floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...John watches a younger version of himself with Norma..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...dancing slowly... twirling... her head on his shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...smiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with a sigh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...before disappearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John swallows -hard- as a trembling hand wipes away a tea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny smiles at him with a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He returns the gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues to sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John raises his glass as-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five pictures of John are inconspicuously taken...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...by DAVID PERKINS -late twenties, cocky, expensive tast lean, cruel- at a table across the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David sends them with a text:     "Is this him?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and he receives a text in return:       "Yes. you?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David texts back:   "The Continental."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and he receives a text:        "We may not enga hostilities upon those premises."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David texts back:   "I'm willing to take the risk."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and he receives a follow up text: "Take him ali Should you fail, we disavow. Should you succeed, we reward... greatly."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as does John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once the song is done, Jenny is met with boisterous applause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with John clapping the hardest among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted -and more than a bit tipsy- John runs a hand al the wall to maintain his balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sings under his breath... humming the tune to IT HAD T YOU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At his door, he fumbles with his key card, but finally manages to open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John closes and locks the door behind him.    He sheds hi jacket, his shoes, and his pants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...flicks off the lights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and crawls beneath the blankets with a sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snowstorm ends, the city suddenly still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat... and two figures appear at one end of the h while three appear at the other end: suits, ties, gloves, and masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them inserts a key card attached to his cell-phone hacks the lock; the light turning from red to green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another places a small, MAGNETIC GUN to the door, adjusts setting, and pulls the trigger-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -causing the latch to leap back from the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...which opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All five men enter, closing the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound asleep, John lays upon his back beneath the covers, snoring softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well-rehearsed, two men focus upon his legs while two foc upon his arms, their hands hovering above an appendage as they wait for the fifth (DAVID)...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who produces a plastic baggie, inside of which rests a damp TOWEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David removes the towel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...counts down with a nod from 3... 2... 1...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a well-oiled machine, hands clasp down upon John's a and legs as David slaps the rag down upon John's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's body tenses as his eyes snap open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but he does not inhale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and John twists at an odd angle, causing one of men holding his arm to lose his grasp. With his one arm free, John reaches up, grabs David's wrist, and snaps it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As David stumbles backwards with a cry, the others pounce upon John...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who produces the K-BAR blade from beneath the blankets driving it into the side of one man's neck once... twice. three times...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...before releasing the blade, arching his back, and wrap his legs around another man's neck, tensing until -SNAP- man's neck breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remaining three -horrified- are at a loss; far remove from their element.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and a gunman run for the door as a third steps back removes his silenced pistol from a shoulder holster, and blindly fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullets etch up along the mattress and into the headboard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as John rolls off the bed, reaches beneath it, and gra the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunman's left leg disappears as -screaming- he sinks the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John fires again, hitting the fallen gunman in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John fires at the fleeing gunman in the open doorway-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -sending him spinning out into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is shot a second time in the back, dead in a blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David rips off his mask as he slides to a stop, hands up, just as John emerges from his room, pumping the shotgun f affect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and he walks towards David, the weapon steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John places the shotgun to the back of David's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is terribly -to an unsettling degree- calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He produces a small pill container, taps out two, and swallows them as he rolls his injured shoulder with a gro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where Iosef is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where Viggo is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N-no, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know anythin' worth knowin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears roll down David's cheeks as he wracks his brain, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because I'm good at killin'... doesn't mean I like it all that much. (a beat, then) Give me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait! (swallowing hard, then) Little Russia. There's a small bank near Cannon Court...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo owns it. It's where he keeps his money. Every dollar of business he does clears through that building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) That'll do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John swings the shotgun, knocking David out with the butt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John freezes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as HARRY -60s, African-American, former NFL receiver, tall, lean, and imposing, yet currently dressed in boxers t-shirt, and dress shoes- aims a pistol at the back of Jo head from the open doorway of his hotel room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinkin' so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Harry lowers his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.    Hey, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry glances about at the bodies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and steps back inside his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night, Harry. (a beat, then) Hey, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry hesitates, but glances out from behind his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keen on earnin' a coin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates, then sighs) Times bein' as they are? Yeah, John... I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind babysittin' the breathin' one for, I dunno... (checking his watch) ...the next six hours or so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch and release?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John tosses Harry a gold coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch and release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the sound of a phone ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry grabs David by the feet as John heads back towards room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry drags David back towards his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters his room, and answers the ringing phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Wick. I'm sorry to be calling you at this hour, but we've received a number of noise complaints from your floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to worry about that anymore. I'll be going to bed soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you any need of -say- a dinner reservation, perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, in fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six o'clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. Oh, and... (hesitating, then) Do you cater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. I'll need a car, and... well... something a bit less trivial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well-lit, but empty; a beautiful expanse of architectural history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John walks with his hands in his pockets, his head down, in thought. He pauses to light himself a cigarette...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a long beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and he lowers his head, flicking ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You willin' to put a bullet in my back, Marcus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emerging from the shadows behind him, Marcus holds a sile pistol, his leather-gloved hand steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Marcus smiles, slipping the pistol back into his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus joins him at the rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John offers him a cigarette-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been awhile, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -which Marcus accepts-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too long, I'd argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -leaning forward to ignite the tip from John's lighter. pulls back with a nod, squinting out into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you take the job then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if not for me, it would have been someone who'd have just now pulled the trigger and simply walked away, leaving you to gasp your last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much appreciated, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, we're the last of our kind; an endangered species of a sort. And I find comfort in knowing that there's someone like me still out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat, then sighs) What am I doing, Marcus? I mean... it is just a... was a... dog, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John runs a trembling hand through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always "just" something, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just" a wife, "just" a son, "just" a friend, "just" a house, "just" a car... "just" a dog... or "just" a cat. Each of these I've lost in no particular order, and each time the pain I felt was quite real. And my chosen reciprocity to each was no more -and no less- brutal than any other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) This isn't like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, nods) Maybe not, but for the rare   man of our ilk -those who survived   an arguably unsurvivable life-   the few things we find time to care   for... pass long before we do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Marcus finishes his cigarette, tossing it out into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus turns, and heads back into the train...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as John continues to stare out into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat... and he produces his cell phone, dialing a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A corner dive, popular, but its population is sparse this early in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A limousine pulls up to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sipping coffee in a corner booth, John watches the front the building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...lowering his mug as VIGGO -accompanied by two men- ent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Wait in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men exit as Viggo walks towards the booth, sheddi his jacket as he does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one of John's hands is above the table, the other hovering beneath it, a pistol held tight, unwavering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo slips into the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that really necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John answers by taking a sip of his coffee. Viggo shrugs with a frown, motioning towards the waitress as he flips his mug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So be it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filling the mug) Cream or sugar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she walks away, Viggo takes a long pull off of his dri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been what? 30 years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's about right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left the game, got married, settled down... I envy that. (a beat, then) Kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tried, but... wasn't in the cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucked a bartender and -ta dah!- nine months later, I had me a piece a' shit tossed on the old doorstep, but... when it comes down to it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured as much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny how one would both die and kill for something they do not love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine what one would do if they did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo nods, takes a sip of his coffee, and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Viggo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo leaves the diner, and slides into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -where four of his men wait, each armed with a silenced, submachine gun: intimidating hardware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo closes the door, takes a deep breath, and sighs, rubbing his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A round slams into his window, barely missing him before hitting the man seated next to him in the side of the hea blood spattering against glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo dives to the floor as his men prepare to return fir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -but John is a crackshot, firing as he strides towards th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -killing two men and wounding a fourth who drops down nex Viggo, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRIVE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John ejects a spent clip, slaps in a fresh one in a blink and unloads into the limousine which jerks forward, tires squealing as it drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo lies on his back, staring at the ceiling as he ligh himself a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People don't change. Do they, John? (to the screaming gunman) SHUT... THE FUCK... UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John slips the gun into the back of his pants, turns, and calmly walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train pulls up and begins to empty, crowding the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John exits the train, stuffs his hands into his pockets, seeks to disappear into the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as KIRILL and TWO GUNMEN spot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move towards him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...following...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...hands reaching beneath their jackets, fingers curling around triggers as silenced pistols are slipped free by steady hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babushka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John slows his stride, hands out to his side, mind racing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With consciousness fading, John leans back upon the floor listening to the voices of his assailants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his face hidden within his mask, Kirill chuckles - enjoying this- as he sucks on a fresh mint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Then shit... let the fuckin' babushka fade away and let's get the fuck outta' here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John tenses, his features hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill grins, willing for John to give him reason to fire

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a frail commuter stumbles into their midst-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -killing each with a single, silenced round to the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill is dead before he hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst a growing sense of chaos, MARCUS shares a parting glance with John, slips the pistol in his pocket, smiles, tips his hat down low over his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John returns the nod and disappears in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John walks up to an old, FORD LTD sedan. He reaches up in a rear wheel well, and rips free a set of keys which had duct-taped within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the trunk: we recognize the suitcases therein as his own. However, there is also a LARGE DUFFEL BAG as wel which he opens, studies its contents, and -satisfied- zip shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the trunk, opens the front door-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -slides inside, starts the engine-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of the quaint old buildings share both English a Russian signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his hands stuffed deep into his pockets, John exits alleyway and ducks into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -where he motions "one" to the waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points towards a booth. He nods, sheds his jacket, ta a seat, and glances down at the menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window, John studies the front facade of A BA building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BANK MANAGER -checking his watch- flips over the sign the door from CLOSED to OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Americano, please.    And a bear claw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the hall to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling on a pair of leather gloves, John walks down the hallway, but instead of turning left, he turns right-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -exiting the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips his jacket inside-out -from black to gray- and s on a face mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching down behind a trash can, he removes a TWO GALLON PLASTIC GAS TANK and a PISTOL before walking back down th alley, and out into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -making a b-line for the Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he walks across the street, traffic stops as onlookers gawk in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John opens the door, and enters-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -firing two shots in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYBODY OUT! (on their looks) NOW!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Customers flee, secretaries scramble after them, as does Bank Manager...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who slides to a halt, John's pistol staring down at hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... why not... me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me to Viggo's stash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha... what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His stash. Personal Holdings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piggy "fucking" Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!?      I can't just-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John fires four shots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...killing the two gunmen who appeared behind the Bank Manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then hushed) This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bank Manager swings open the door, revealing two wall safety-deposit boxes on either side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with a large door in the rear of the vault leading int secondary vault. A keypad is attached to its face replete with a fingerprint reader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John presses the barrel of the gun to the back of the Ban Manager's head and forces him into the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So will I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank manager hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then presses a thumb to the reader and types in a code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and the door opens with a hiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, p-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pistol-whips the Bank Manager, knocking him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without really looking inside-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -John tosses the plastic gas can into the secondary vault and unloads the pistol...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...into the gas can which explodes into flame, illuminati the space to reveal pallets of cash, smuggled artwork, jewels, and the like stashed therein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John tosses the pistol inside, and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the fire grows, devouring the millions of dollars in liquid assets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John casually walks across the street, ignoring the gawke and enters the alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bank Manager comes to with a groan, pulling himself u his feet. His jaw draw drops -eyes wide- at the sight of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...fuck... me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John tosses the gloves and mask into the trash, turns his jacket back out, slips it back on, and enters-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -walking down the hallway to enter-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -slipping into his seat as the Waitress arrives with his coffee and donut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll do. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes a deep breath, exhales...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and relaxes as across the street, the Bank Manager eme from the building, and flees off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and the trio of intimidating sedans pull up to curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunmen in the rear and front vehicles emerge, studyin their surroundings. A beat... and one of the gunman slaps hand to the roof of the center car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proceeded -and preceded- by a bodyguard, Viggo emerges, stuffs his hands into his pockets, and marches into the b as across the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...John watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cops. That's new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We good, hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    Yeah, we're good. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress rips the receipt off of her pad-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and drops it on the table in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands, tosses a twenty down on top of it, turns, an leaves, snagging a toothpick at the cashier's booth befor exiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John walks, he reaches down behind a trash can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and retrieves a LARGE BRIEFCASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo stands in the center of the small room with his hea down, prodding a smoldering Picasso with the tip of his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Where's the manager?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is met by silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) I'd run, too. (a beat, then in English) What a shame... what a fucking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...shame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo is trembling with rage, hands clenched at his sides eyes unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) Iosef... my son... is worth less than this... far less... treasures reduced to ash... (in Russian, subtitled) ...ash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his head down -hands stuffed deep into his pockets, cigarette smoldering between his lips- Viggo exits, slowl making his way towards his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perched behind the wheel -the driver's side window missin John shifts gears, slams his foot down onto the gas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and narrows his eyes, tensing, his knuckles creaking f within leather gloves as his fingers constrict around the wheel of the stolen vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunmen react to the sound of the engine's roar, the t nearest it's approach dropping to a knee, aiming, and fir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets slam into the windshield -a round slashing into John's cheek, clipping his ear- and engine block before t front left tire blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John loses control of the truck which fishtails wildly, slamming into a sedan, crushing two gunmen before it cartwheels through their midst, killing three more before coming to a stop on its side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gunmen pushes Viggo towards the center sedan-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) GET IN! NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -shoving him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three gunmen approach the truck, firing repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazed, John -his face cut by glass, fresh wounds seeping blood- reaches over into the open briefcase, removing the silenced-UZI therein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John shoots out the sunroof, dragging himself free of the vehicle as he ducks for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Sedan peels out, John swiftly ejects the clip, sel another -wrapped in blue tape, these ARMOR-PIERCING BULLE are dark gray, seemingly sharpened to a tip- from a clip belt, slaps it into weapon, drops to a knee and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -as the Sedan drives past-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -depresses the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets easily punch through the doors and windows, riddl the dash..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the passenger, the driver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the seats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...one gunmen, Viggo, another gunmen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sedan veers off, plummeting into the store front of a pharmacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John ejects the spent clip, selects another wrapped in bl tape, turns towards the fallen truck, and pulls the trigg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullets punch through the roof, seats/floor, and undercarriage of the vehicle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...cutting the remaining gunmen to shreds on the sidewalk behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clip empties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John tosses the Uzi into the truck, turns, and walks towa the store front from which the rear half of a sedan protrudes, pausing to slip free a silenced-pistol from a man's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters, glancing into the Sedan as he moves past: th gunmen are all dead, but Viggo is missing, a rear door op

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John rounds the corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to see a trail of blood.    He follows it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to find Viggo dragging his broken body, his switchblad one hand, his cellphone in the other. The knife is unceremoniously dropped as he struggles to dial 9... 1...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...before the phone slips through his fingers, slick with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) NO! NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands over him, the pistol level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if sensing him, Viggo rolls over with a groan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, John... and please... be honest... am I dying here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hesitates, squats, and retrieves Viggo's cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless I complete the call, then... yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me to die like this... (spitting, enraged) ...BECAUSE OF HIM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...would be unfortunate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo is fading... fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sending Iosef to a safe house in Moscow. I arranged for transport via... a grain ship... out of Newark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viggo coughs, trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands, dials an additional "1", and the send button

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but it is too late:   Viggo is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John tosses the phone down onto Viggo's chest, slips the into the back of his pants, turns and as he walks towards store front...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...grabs a bottle of rubbing alcohol from the shelf, unscrewing the cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John dumps the bottle onto his head, gritting his teeth, behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the sedan EXPLODES behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John does not react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses aside the bottle, stuffs his hands into his pockets, lowers his head, and walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David sits in a chair with his head down: his ankles, wri mouth, and eyes bound by duct tape. A weathered hand reac over and RIPS the tape off of his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David winces out of pain and the brutal sensation of ligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Housekeepin'll find ya'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in a three-piece suit, Harry places an old -but gingerly cared for- hat upon his head, a ring upon his fi glistening, his watch an enviable antique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But son? You done a bit a' business on the Continental grounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry lifts his suitcase and turns heading for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and management, well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry opens the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they don't take kindly to that sort a' thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and exits, leaving the door ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David slumps in his seat; exhausted, broken, and defeated

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day becomes night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bustling mecca of commerce, the port never sleeps; ship of all shapes and sizes dock, empty their shipment, refil with return cargo, and slip out into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A multi-hulled beast of a ship, THE CHAYKA (Seagull) rest dock-side, its bridge guarded by a small army of security guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overhead, scattered throughout the cranes, are a half-doz SNIPERS, searching/studying the dockyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cellophane-wrapped pallets of WEAPONS and bales of CASH a carried by forklifts into the center of the hull and bolt to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, two dozen high-end, luxury cars enter the hull each driven into its own reinforced, steel crate, the doo sealed shut behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the last WORKER leaves, he shouts into his walkie-talk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FILL HER UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overhead, a large chute appears-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and the OPERATOR presses a button, sending a seemingly endless stream of grain down into the hull, covering the smuggled goods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chewing on an unlit cigar, the CAPTAIN -60s, enormous, grizzled, salt-and-pepper beard, long, unkempt hair, dres in denim and leather- studies paperwork at his desk while Iosef paces; a cigarette in one hand, a drink in the othe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck long do I have to stay down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until we are at sea, and even then, your access up top will be limited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain's phone rings.   He answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain's face falls, his jaw clenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let him know. Proceed as scheduled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain hangs up, finds a match, sparks it to flame, ignites the tip of his cigar, puffing it like an old stea engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     He was k-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain is cut off by the intercom which squawks to l a screaming voice reduced to panicked static. The Captain slaps a hand down onto the call button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're taking fire, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of security guards lay dead upon the deck -bleed out from single gunshot wounds- as the others sprint for cover. The Operator leans hard against the call button of the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's shooting at u-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A round slams into the side of the Operator's head, killi him instantly, his body sinking to the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain stands, checks the chamber of the LUGER PISTO his side, and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until you hear otherwise... stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain exits the cabin and slams the door behind him Trembling, Iosef latches close the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and pours himself a tall drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SNIPER searches the yard through his scope, his earpiec overwhelmed by panicked chatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Alpha. I don't-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the way, another sniper tumbles off his perch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as does another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sniper searches, his skin wet with perspiration, hand trembling upon the stock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and another, screaming as he falls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHERE THE FUCK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sniper has found John...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old cannery. Southeast of my position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but it is too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His body goes limp...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and slides out of his perch, cart-wheeling down to the earth below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIGHT HEAVILY-ARMORED SUV's bear down on the old cannery building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John shifts position, aims, and fires-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -but the round ricochets off the bulletproof window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John ejects the clip, ejects a round, leans the weapon against the window, and sinks back into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parade of SUVs enter the cannery, their tires screech to a stop as a swarm of highly-trained gunmen emerge, scattering throughout the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pries open the doors of an old, wooden, elevator sha now an empty cavern disappearing down into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of gunmen swiftly close in on John...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who takes a deep breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and jumps-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -bullets riddling the doors behind him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -disappearing down into the darkness-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -his body SLAPPING against the water as he sinks like a stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gunmen rounds a corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...stepping over the empty duffel bag we last saw in John trunk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and freezes, his eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS POV: A brick of C-4 is attached to one of the main support beams, the pale red light of the detonator glowin with ominous disdain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a step back, lowering his weapon, and glances about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...noticing for the first time the RED LIGHTS of a DOZEN MORE C-4 charges scattered throughout the interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underwater, John lifts his hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to reveal a REMOTE DETONATER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...which he depresses with his thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunman goes pale at the sight of all of those red lights... turning green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of powerful explosion tear through the building, reducing it to splinters as it collapses in upon itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As debris begins to sink down all around him, John swims hard as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surfacing when he is safe, gasping for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finding a ladder, John climbs upwards-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -emerging from behind an access panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns towards the ship and moves at a steady pace, e roving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded by crewmen and security personnel, the Captain watches the explosion, his eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My... God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a pistol echoes up past them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... he's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his pistol held in both hands -soaked to the bone- J strides towards the boat's entryway, dropping five guards with two perfectly-placed shots apiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ejects the spent clips, slaps in a replacement, drops knee, and fires off six shots at the two gunmen as they r the corner, dead before they hit the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John drops his pistol, retrieves a submachine gun off a d guard, unfolds the stock, presses it to his shoulder, and enters the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a trembling hand, Iosef pours himself a drink, stari at the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...from behind which is heard the sound of sheer, unadulterated chaos: gunfire, screams, and explosions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door, goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef drops his glass, and unlatches the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain stumbles into the room, leaning heavy against desk, pausing to take a swig of whisky, blood trickling d from his forehead, his left arm limp at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain reloads, reaches into his drawer, finds a snu nosed .38, and tosses it to Iosef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how to use that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Follow me. And if you shoot me in the back, I'll be the one to fuckin' kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain swings open the door, and -with his pistol in both hands- enters-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -bodies lay everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunshots ring out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of panicking crewmen flee the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef stays close to the Captain, his sweaty hands clingi to the pistol. As the Captain rounds the corner-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -as he and John collide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as John looks past the Captain, his eyes locking onto Iosef...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who -panicking- raises his pistol, and FIRES-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -hitting the Captain in the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You piece of shit, motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef turns and flees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as the Captain and John disarm one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain roars -in pain and anger- driving a fist into John's side, breaking ribs. He follows through with a wil left, but John avoids it, slapping it aside, the Captain' forward momentum sending his fist to SHATTER again the ir wall of his ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain howls, wrapping his arms around John, crushin him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and as consciousness begins to fade...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...John's teeth close around the captain's nose, cleaving from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, the Captain releases John who kicks out his knee moves behind him, wraps his arms around the wounded man's head, and SNAPS his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef emerges from the lower deck, firing back into the darkness as tears roll down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and John emerges, the very visage of death: his chest etched with bullet wounds, blood trickling down his face, wet, dirty, wounded, pale, and yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...unstoppable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John moves at a steady pace, the gun in his hand at his s arm limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef sprints towards the far end of the ship, and climbs the ladder towards the pilothouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overlooking the entire ship's deck, the pilothouse offers little in the way of escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead, Iosef now finds himself trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He searches the desk and finds a LETTER OPENER which he yields like a knife, turning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as John enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come on, muthafucka!   LET'S DANCE! YOU AND ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and John raises the pistol, and fires off his l round, punching a hole in the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef grins, laughing as John drops his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John surges into Iosef...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...whose hand comes down with the letter opener. John catches his wrist, and snaps it as his right hand darts u constricts around Iosef's jaw, cracking it in two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...lifting him from with the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Moose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and hurling him through the pane of glass which EXPLOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREAMING, Iosef tumbles end over end, his body slamming chute from which grain continues to pour, the hull close full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iosef cartwheels over it and lands half-in/half-out of th hull, SNAPPING his back, as around him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...grain piles higher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as he sinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!    HELP ME! NO! N...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While his legs remain on deck, his upper torso sinks slightly, the grain covering his face, muting his screams

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as he suffocates to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stares down at him for a long moment, turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence as a soft snow begins to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and a sedan rounds the corner, takes it too wide, and crashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perched behind the wheel with his head down, John groans, leaning back as snow wafts through the door's broken side window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls himself out of the vehicle, stumbles a few fee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -leans heavy against the wall, and slides into a sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Wick looks to be on death's very doorstep....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...however...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...death will not take him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With an almost frustrated/irritated groan John pulls hims to his feet, and staggers down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small, simple, and clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and an elbow is driven through the door's windo John reaches in, unlocks the door, opens it, enters, and closes it behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John grabs an empty box and begins filling it with instruments, medication, bandages, and the like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters to find an empty room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...save a single YOUNG DOG -a mutt of no distinguishable breed, three years old- who sits staring at him, offering little more than a tilt of its head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John strips and -using the hose attachment- rinses his bo clean: the damage is extensive with cuts, bruises, and th bullet holes (one in his shoulder, one his side, and one his chest).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John studies the bullet wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through and through... through and through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However when he gets to the one in his chest-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buried deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John swallows a handful of pills, clenches his teeth, and using a pair of needle nose pliers- reaches into the woun searching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until he finds the bullet which he pulls free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John cleans the wounds with disinfectant, applies a numbe pads/bandages, and studies himself in the mirror: he is a complete and total wreck... but alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Searching, John finds some surgical garb; thin pants and shirt which he slips into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes a jacket off of the rack, tries it on -too sma moves on to the second one, and it fits. John flicks off light, and leaves the room. A long beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and John returns, turning the light back on. From acro the room, he stares at the young dog, studying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog makes no sound, tilting it's head from side to si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and John walks to the cage, removing the clipbo from its side, reading it: we can see that the dog is scheduled to be put down tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miko, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miko replies with a tilt of her head-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's quite the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and a paw pressed to the side of the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John smiles, places the clipboard on top of the cage, and opens its door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miko doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat... and Miko leaps down onto the floor, tail waggin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes a leash off of the wall, and clips it to Miko' collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   Let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Miko emerge from the Veterinarian's Office and w out into the snow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...disappearing into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his arm in a cast, DAVID makes his way through the kitchen, his expensive suit freshly pressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David enters dry storage, makes his way to the back, and walks down the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he approaches the door, he searches his pocket for a g coin, finding one. He slips it into the slit in the door. long beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and down below, it clatters out into a small receptacl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Perkins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...over his shoulder, we see Winston emerge from the shad behind him, a silenced-pistol held steady in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...your membership to the Continental has been -by thine own hand- revoked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a key slipped into an ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It turns, the engine roaring to life, tires squealing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sleek, clean, black as night, 1969 Ford Mustang `Boss 429' sprints down the tarmac as inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Miko holds her head out of the open window, her eyes narrowed, mouth open, and tongue flapping in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John smiles, reaches over, and scratches her on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good girl, Miko... good girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang charges off into the distance.
